cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 115 mi (180 km) SSW of Negril, Jamaica and 210 mi (340 km) SE of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the northwest Caribbean, forecast to cross western Cuba Friday, enter the southeastern Gulf of Mexico Saturday, and continue northwest toward the northern U.S. Gulf Coast late Sunday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast (near Port Fourchon–Grand Isle area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for U.S. coast as of Advisory #1
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for U.S. coast as of Advisory #1
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from Texas to the Florida Panhandle, including Mississippi and Alabama coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds increasingly likely Sunday; hurricane-force gusts possible if the track shifts eastward toward Mississippi coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential for 3–6 ft storm surge along the Mississippi coast late Sunday into early Monday if the center nears Louisiana while intensifying.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could produce 4–8 inches of rainfall Sunday–Monday across coastal Mississippi, with localized higher amounts.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning this weekend; possible coastal flooding and short-fuse tornadoes in outer rain bands.
